resources.string: The Listen Up Platform for Action has been designed by a collective of Ugandan and South Sudanese refugee women"s groups, GBV, child protection, and wider protection actors, livelihoods, health and education actors, women"s participation, gender equality and PSEA experts with support and guidance from IRC.
This app provides you with up-to-date information on Gender-Based Violence related services in Bidi Bidi. Additionally, you can report issues regarding equitable and safe access to services.
Across the top of the app you will find a set of icons.

To retrieve the latest information, tap the Sync icon. You will need mobile data or a WiFi connection for this to work. You will also need an account on the Listen Up Platform website. The first time the app is run, the sync will start automatically.
The app displays service locations on a map. To move the map to your current location, tap the location icon.
You can toggle the display to show a list of locations instead of the map view by tapping on the list icon.
When you are in the list view, you can tap the map icon to return to the map display. You can also tap the location tag next to each location in the list to find that location on the map.
You can find specific locations for services by tapping on the search icon. You can search by name, or by the types of services required.
Finally you can report issues with safe and equitable access to services by tapping on the red button at the bottom right of the screen.
